Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Yearly \Year"ly\, a. [AS. ge['a]rlic.] [1913 Webster] 1. Happening, accruing, or coming every year; annual; as, a yearly income; a yearly feast. [1913 Webster]
2. Lasting a year; as, a yearly plant. [1913 Webster]
3. Accomplished in a year; as, the yearly circuit, or revolution, of the earth. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Yearly \Year"ly\, adv. [AS. ge['a]rlice.] Annually; once a year to year; as, blessings yearly bestowed. [1913 Webster]
Yearly will I do this rite. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

yearly adj : occurring or payable every year; "an annual trip to Paris"; "yearly medical examinations"; "annual (or yearly) income" [syn: {annual}] adv : without missing a year; "they travel to China annually" [syn: {annually}, {every year}, {each year}]
